intro: Aralia ryukyuensis var. inermis, commonly known as the Okinawan aralia, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring compound leaves with a serrated margin. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by berries that mature to a dark red color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
